title: Degree Apprenticeship Mathematics Competency Enhancement Program Using Game-Based Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics and experience in job-related data analysis
context.additional_context: Flexible learning schedules and application-oriented content centered on simulation games for working learners

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to apply mathematical concepts to real-world problems through scenario-based simulation games
Improve mathematics problem-solving strategies with over 80% accuracy based on peer feedback in online flipped classroom discussions

Learners are required to write a reflective journal once a week, developing a concrete action plan (3+ steps) to apply at least one of the mathematical concepts learned that week (e.g., statistical analysis, data interpretation) to a work setting (e.g., inventory management, budget planning), and obtain approval from their supervising manager.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
